column4: UPDATE 1-Amazon China approved to provide ocean freight services

column4: PRESS DIGEST - Wall Street Journal - Jan 14
column5: Jan 14 The following are the top stories in the Wall Street Journal. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

column4: Slowing data center revenue growth dims Intel's profit beat
column5: Intel Corp's  strong quarterly profit beat was overshadowed by concerns about slowing revenue growth in its highly profitable data center business  sending its shares down about 5.6 percent in after-market trading.

column4: UPDATE 3-Slowing data center revenue growth dims Intel's profit beat
column5: * Shares fall 5.6 pct after market   (Adds Q1 forecast  executive comment)

column4: Intel revenue rises marginally
column5: Jan 14 Intel Corp reported a marginal rise in quarterly revenue  reversing two quarters of declines  as growth in its data center business more than offset weak sales to PC makers.

column4: JetBlue restores booking but still recovering from outage
column5: NEW YORK JetBlue Airways Corp said it has restored online booking and check-in after a power outage shut its main website for about two hours on Thursday  raising concern about delayed flights.

column4: Best Buy lowers sales outlook after holiday sales drop

column4: UPDATE 2-Best Buy lowers sales outlook after holiday sales drop

column4: BHP Billiton slashes U.S. shale assets value by $7.2 billion

column5: LOMBARD  Ill. A potential merger of Canadian Pacific Railway Ltd and Norfolk Southern would make it hard for No. 3 U.S. railroad CSX Corp to survive alone and ratchet up pressure for more industry consolidation  the chairman of No. 2 U.S. railroad BNSF said on Thursday.

column5: SAO PAULO  Jan 14 Petróleo Brasileiro SA  the Brazilian state-controlled firm at the center of a massive corruption investigation  said asset divestments hinged on a number of undetermined "global and external factors"  as regulators questioned it over the sale of a stake in petrochemical giant Braskem SA.

column4: Pfizer weighing sale of Hospira's pump business -Bloomberg
column5: Jan 13 Drugmaker Pfizer Inc is thinking about selling hospital products maker Hospira's infusion pump business for about $2 billion  Bloomberg reported  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: Buffett expands oil bet  buys more Phillips 66
column5: Warren Buffett is expanding his bet on the oil industry  slowly adding to his already large stake in oil refiner Phillips 66  even as crude oil prices have sunk to a 12-year low.

column5: Jan 14 Warren Buffett is expanding his bet on the oil industry  slowly adding to his already large stake in oil refiner Phillips 66 even as crude oil prices have sunk to a 12-year low.

column4: RPT-Lockheed says committed to commercial helicopter market
column5: WASHINGTON  Jan 14 Lockheed Martin is committed to the commercial helicopter market despite shrinkage in the sector due to the slide in oil prices since it took over Sikorsky Aircraft from United Technologies Corp last year  a senior executive told Reuters on Thursday.

column4: Shaw posts unexpected profit drop as it loses TV subscribers
column5: Canada's Shaw Communications Inc posted an unexpected 4 percent fall in first-quarter profit as a continued drop in television subscriptions offset a rise in internet accounts.

column4: UPDATE 2-Shaw posts unexpected profit drop as it loses TV subscribers

column4: Canada's Shaw Communications profit falls as it loses TV subscribers
column5: Jan 14 Shaw Communications Inc on Thursday reported a 4 percent fall in first-quarter profit  as it continued to lose television subscribers  offsetting a rise in internet accounts.

column4: State Street to pay $12 mln to settle pay-to-play scheme in Ohio
column5: WASHINGTON State Street Corp will pay $12 million to settle allegations that it conducted a pay-to-play scheme to win Ohio pension fund contracts  U.S. regulators said Thursday.

column4: Samsung Electronics to produce new Qualcomm chips in blow to TSMC
column5: SEOUL Qualcomm Inc said on Thursday Samsung Electronics Co Ltd will become the sole manufacturer of its new flagship mobile chip  a major boost for the South Korean tech giant as it vies for deals with bigger rival TSMC.

column4: Taiwan stocks slump on Wall St losses; TSMC down before quarterly results
column5: TAIPEI  Jan 14 Taiwan stocks fell to four-and-half-a-month lows on Thursday as steep losses on Wall Street highlighted concerns about the global economic outlook  with Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd (TSMC)  in focus ahead of its fourth-quarter results.

column4: United Technologies names new head of Pratt & Whitney engine unit
column5: NEW YORK United Technologies Corp  on Thursday named Robert Leduc as president of its Pratt & Whitney aircraft engine division  succeeding Paul Adams  who is retiring.

column4: UPDATE 1-WebMD says not in talks over a potential acquisition
column5: Jan 14 Healthcare portal WebMD Health Corp  said on Thursday it was not negotiating a sale of all or part of its business  a day after the Financial Times reported about talks over a potential deal.

column4: Wal-Mart closed over 10 percent of Brazil stores in restructuring: sources
column5: CHICAGO/SAO PAULO Wal-Mart Stores Inc  has closed about 60 stores in Brazil  or more than 10 percent of its locations in the country  part of a restructuring of one of the retailing giant's most important overseas markets  people familiar with the matter said.

column4: UPDATE 2-Walmex gets new CEO from Wal-Mart Brazil
column5: MEXICO CITY  Jan 14 Mexico's Walmex  the country's biggest retailer  on Thursday named Guilherme Loureiro its new chief executive officer from Feb. 1.

column4: Infosys bridges gap with rivals after lucrative deal wins
column5: BENGALURU Infosys Ltd cheered investors with a forecast-beating quarterly profit and a stronger sales growth outlook  as India's second-largest software services exporter regains market share from rivals by sharpening its focus on high-margin services.

column4: Argentina signs $500 million shale deal with American Energy Partners
column5: BUENOS AIRES State-run energy firm YPF said on Thursday it had signed a preliminary deal worth more than $500 million over three years with American Energy Partners LP (AEP) to explore for shale gas in Argentina's vast Vaca Muerta formation.

column4: Cheniere Energy delays export of first LNG cargo
column5: Jan 14 Cheniere Energy Partners LP  delayed the first export of liquefied natural gas cargo from its Sabine Pass liquefaction project in Louisiana  citing "instrumentation issues".
